meanings.definition: Hotpresses (verb): applies pressure and heat to something
meanings.sent1: She hotpresses the fabric to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The tailor hotpresses the seams to ensure they stay flat.
meanings.sent3: The chef hotpresses the dough to create perfectly shaped cookies.
meanings.sent4: The athlete hotpresses the muscles to relieve tension after a workout.
meanings.sent5: The artist hotpresses the clay to mold it into intricate shapes.

meanings.definition: Hotpresses (noun): a machine used for applying pressure and heat to something
meanings.sent1: The factory uses hotpresses to laminate the wood panels.
meanings.sent2: The hotpresses in the workshop are essential for making custom furniture.
meanings.sent3: The hotpresses hum softly as they work their magic on the materials.
meanings.sent4: The hotpresses in the print shop create crisp and clear prints.
meanings.sent5: The hotpresses in the bakery ensure the bread rises perfectly.
